com.codemelon.graph.edge

Class WeightedEdge

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.codemelon.graph.edge.WeightedEdge

  • public class WeightedEdge
extends java.lang.Object
    Immutable, undirected edges that maintain a floating point weight. Since the edge is undirected, the distinction between head and tail or from and to is arbitrary. Once the edge has been initialized, it will alway show the same from() and to() vertices, but it is equivalent to an edge object having opposite from() and to() vertices.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WeightedEdge(Vertex from, Vertex to)
      Construct an immutable weighted edge.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WeightedEdge

        public WeightedEdge(Vertex from,
            Vertex to)
        Construct an immutable weighted edge. The weight of the edge is set when the edge object is created and is not synchronized with the graph. So, if the edge weight is updated in the graph, the corresponding weighted edge will not be changed.
        Parameters:
        from - tail vertex
        to - head vertex
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if from or to does not belong to a graph
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if from or to do not belong to the same graph
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the graph does not contain the given edge

    • Method Detail

      • from

        public Vertex from()
        Returns one end of the given edge. Note that the edge is undirected, so the distinction between head and tail or from and to is arbitrary. Once the edge has been initialized, it will alway show the same from() and to() vertices, but it is equivalent to an edge object having opposite from() and to() vertices.
        Returns:
        the "from" vertex specified in the constructor

      • to

        public Vertex to()
        Returns one end of the given edge. Note that the edge is undirected, so the distinction between head and tail or from and to is arbitrary. Once the edge has been initialized, it will alway show the same from() and to() vertices, but it is equivalent to an edge object having opposite from() and to() vertices.
        Returns:
        the "from" vertex specified in the constructor

      • weight

        public double weight()
        Returns the edge's weight.
        Returns:
        the edge's weight

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Since weighted edges are undirected, they are equal not only if they have the same tail and head but also if they have opposite tails and heads. That is, 2 edges e1 and e2 are equal if either of the following conditions holds:
        1. e1.from() == e2.from() && e1.to() == e2.to(), or
        2. e1.from() == e2.to() && e1.to() == e2.from()
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Overridden so that adding weighted edges to a HashSet will automatically eliminate duplicates. We want edges that are equal (according to the equals() method) to have the same hash code.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
